thread.title: O'Hare Airport No. 1 in world for 2014 flights; 2015 passenger volume up 9%
thread.title_full: O'Hare Airport No. 1 in world for 2014 flights; 2015 passenger volume up 9%

title: O'Hare Airport No. 1 in world for 2014 flights; 2015 passenger volume up 9%
text:
O'Hare Airport No. 1 in world for 2014 flights; 2015 passenger volume up 9% Aug 31, 2015, 2:54pm CDT Industries & Tags Tim Boyle | Bloomberg Passenger traffic is up more than 9 percent at O'Hare International Airport so far thisâ€¦ more O'Hare International Airport passed Atlanta's Hartsfield-Jackson Airport to become the world's busiest airport when it comes to the number of annual flights. The Chicago airport had 881,933 flights last year, surpassing 2013's top airport, Atlanta, which had 868,359 flights, according to the latest Airports Council International (ACI) World Airport Traffic Report . Los Angeles International Airport was No. 3 in the world, with 709,000 flights. So far this year, O'Hare's flights are up a tad from a year earlier, up 0.17 percent from last year, according to the latest statistics . Passenger volume is up more than 9 percent at O'Hare compared with the same time last year. Atlanta remains the world's busiest airport when it comes to the number of passengers, with 96.2 million passengers in 2014. In March, ACI ranked Chicago's O'Hare as the world's seventh-busiest airport, in terms of passengers, with nearly 70 million 2014 passengers. 
Get Chicago
